Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: George B
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife did stay in April with a Cosmos tour. Our room was comfortable, nice, clean with a large and pleasant bathroom. Nice location with easy access to the City by bus or taxi. Polite and professional staff will help you in all you need ! Our breakfast was ok, and Restaurant has been fantastic ! What a delicious fish we had ! High quality service of all staff. Everyone can reach Venice island from the hotel in a really easy way. Map, bus schedule and more info were available at desk! Good service!!For us it was the best hotel in our tour and we will return to Italy and to HOTEL POPPI!!

Reviews.Title: “Staff very friendly!”
Reviews.Author: sach1593
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my Cosmos tour. Room was clean and plenty of room. The staff was very nice and explained how to get back from the heart of Venice via the city bus. My husband and I wanted to sightsee and not return to the hotel early with the group. Bus # 80 brought us back about 1/2 a block from the hotel. We had an awesome trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Simon D
Reviews.Content: I have been there with a Cosmos Group few days ago. My room was clean and large enough. I went to the city centre..it has been not difficult at all. Staff did help us and we had a fantastic trip with lot of fun ! ( You can reach The island in about 20 minutes with a local bus ). Very kind hotel staff ! We had a buffet-dinner and we did enjoy the food a lot ! Nice calm place with a big shopping-mall nearby (cheap and big grossery in there !) Well I liked this place a lot !

Reviews.Title: “Nothing wrong with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: hopeless61
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here June 2011 as part of the Cosmos Italy/Greece tour. Room was good as was the staff. Would stay here again and probably will in 2013. Thank you for and enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: norabaiou
Reviews.Content: I understand that hotels are expensive in the Venice region, but the Mira Hotel, although convenient, is offering terrible bathroom facilities. I could hardly fit in the shower room and not even bend to pick up my soap when it fell on the floor. we all strugled to have our shower. I don't believe they would the safety standards. Wireless not working as well. Otherwise, hotel and staff OK.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking in amenities”
Reviews.Author: dextervhc
Reviews.Content: Room was an OK size, not big but not as cramped as many other European hotels. No tissues in the room or bathroom which was weird. There was a plastic stool in the bathroom which I guess would be handy for use in the shower for elderly/infirm etc. Iron in room! Was woken up in the night by a beetle flying into my face. For some reason, in the evening the lights went out. They only work when the room key card is in a slot near the door, but the card was in so i have no idea why the lights would go out. Needless to say, it was a pain in the neck as it was pitch black in the room, I couldn't find anything with the number for the front desk on it with the help of my mobile phone light and I was in my pajamas so I didn't exactly want to go down to reception in those! Luckily the lights went back on within a few minutes but it was very annoying to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property-family run”
Reviews.Author: kgoldgirlnj
Reviews.Content: Stayed Nov,2011 with Cosmos. Not feeling well and stayed at the hotel with 2 others one day. This is a beautiful building and most of the staff, except for front desk is family-Parents, children and grandchildren, especially in dining room. Nice buffet breakfast (eggs and sausage) and nice buffet dinner. Didn't realize until we went down for lunch that there were no nearby restaurants. We were seated in dining room and I put my napkin on my lap. When we looked at the menu we realized that we were out of our league. Cheapest thing on menu was soup @ 10 euros. We decided not to eat, and excused ourselves. The gentleman who seated us took great offense, picked up my napkin, shook it at me and said "Very bad, very bad'. It did not surprise me that we were the only ones in the dining room. The lunch special was 25 euros. We walked down a back street to a supermarket and purchased rolls, lunch meat, cheese, sodas, cookies and crackers for 9 euros and had a picnic in our room. The room and bed were good, spotless clean, normal sized bathroom for europe. The property is extremely well maintained and formal. Don't think we could have afforded to stay there if we had not been on a tour.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Max F
Reviews.Content: We have been here with a group for 2 nights. Very nice hotel with good dinner & breakfast. kind and helpful staff made our stay very comfortable. There is a bus running every 30 minutes into the city-centre. We spent great time there. We will recommend this hotel to our friends for sure !

Reviews.Title: “Venice easily accessible by bus”
Reviews.Author: sydneyplum
Reviews.Content: Stayed as part of tour group. It's located on a state highway and not in Venice. However frequent buses every 30 min to Venice and trip takes about 15 min. 2.60 euro one way. Can by tix at the front desk. Bus stop located down the road from hotel on opposite site and contrary to previous reviews the road is not that hard to cross (similar to every other busy city roads just with more trucks) Bus will drop you back near a shopping mall about 5 min away which apparently becomes a prostitution area once it gets dark. One particular reception staff was very helpful and will give you all the info you need to get the bus to Venice. He was obviously aware that the tour guide lies when he tells the tour group that you can only reach Venice by getting a bus to the port than getting motorboat across that will take u an hour! (not true at all!) The bus drops you off in Venice autostation in the other side from St Marco. Wifi for a fee, cheapest option being 10 euros for 24 hrs. Breakfast was bit disappointing however buffet dinner was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Higher End by Italian Standards”
Reviews.Author: LuvTheSault
Reviews.Content: This is a relatively new hotel. The rooms were standard European size (smaller than North American standards) but the bathroom was a treat because it was large by Euro standards. The air conditioning was functional but I couldn't get it as cold as I would have liked for the two nights we spent but it was about 40 degress Celcius outside so I was grateful for anything. The food, food service and housekeeping was excellent. The only service problem was at the front desk where one of the gentlemen was extremely arrogant to an Italian guest. I would have given him a pass but he was the same the next day and was rude to one of his female co-workers in front of guests. He was the only unprofessional person in this hotel so, assuming he won't be there by the time you book it, I would strongly recommend this hotel. Yes, it's about 20 minutes outside of Venice

Reviews.Title: “Location not the best”
Reviews.Author: Phil I
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a Cosmos tour for 2 nights (2 adults and a 12yr old) Room was comfortable even though small and the shower was small as well - bathroom though was big. Beds comfortable, staff good, food ok Being on a tour the distance from Venice (about 30 minutes) was not really an issue but public transport seemed to be a real issue - front of the hotel a very very busy road and difficult to cross. Shops down the road about 5 minutes walk and others on the tour just said it was "interesting" even though we didnt go there. In an ideal world you would stay in Venice but it was not that much of a problem staying here. We were well looked after and found the staff trustworthy - we left a wallet in the room for the whole day and it was till there untouched at days end - our guide stated there wer very honest and we would agree. Venice is a place you need to experience and the Hotel Poppi is one that can let you do this.

Reviews.Title: “sleep with the "ladies of the night"”
Reviews.Author: cluffne
Reviews.Content: Interesting location....!!!!, 100m from a supermarket that turned into a hooker hang out at night. Hotel staff not very helpful, in advising us they sold bus tickets to Venice, which was approx 20 mins away by bus. The bus stop was 100m across an extremely busy highway, crossing was like playing Russian Rulette with your life. Fridge in room 101 didnt work, we were given 2 single beds with the bathroom being only for anorexic people. The shower was SOOOO small, if you bent or moved, you would either turn it off or get scoldered by hot water. We requested a room move, and were given room 220, which was more comfortable, however the shower cubical was still extremely small. Wi-Fi internet available, for a hefty price.

Reviews.Title: “Very Dissapointed with Hotel”
Reviews.Author: clifford1745
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel on a Cosmos Best of Europe Tour the hotel was very disappointing as it was in the middle of nowhere The meal in the restaurant was also disappointing, the rooms were not up to scratch the shower been very small. Also found it hard to find much about hotel on website.

Reviews.Title: “The size of the room was okay afterall”
Reviews.Author: elaineh011
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a Cosmos tour. Prior to leaving on the tour we had been lead to believe that the Hotel Poppi had impossibly small rooms. While our room was small, it wasn't impossibly small. In fact we managed quite well. The bed was comfortable and the hotel was quiet, giving us a good night's sleep. The bathroom was a 'one person at a time' room. Although a cake of soap was provided there was no shower gel. Unlike some hotels this one had a bit of character to it and we enjoyed our stay. We discovered there was a supermarket about 10 mins stroll away from the hotel were you could purchase bottled water at a cheap price. (Note: It is necessary to buy bottled water in Italy for drinking). It was a bit heavy carrying back 6 bottles in the heat of the afternoon sun but we managed. If you are on a tour bus suggest to the driver that he calls here first to allow you to purchase water before going on to the hotel, thus avoiding having to walk back to the hotel with it.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and probably we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: sunlightManuel
Reviews.Content: We have been here with a Cosmos group few days ago. Our room was fine and very clean Staff gave us a great help about how to reach the city (the first night). We had a great buffet at the second night. Pretty garden is located behind the hotel. We had a nice party with all friends there . We will recommend to our friends !

Reviews.Title: “Smallest Room I've ever seen!”
Reviews.Author: Bette P
Reviews.Content: It's well known that European hotel rooms are generally small. However, this was the smallest hotel room I've ever seen. The bathroom was even smaller. In order to sit on the toilet, your legs had to twist to the side because the sink was in the way. On the plus side, you could brush your teeth and answer nature's call at the same time! The rooms were clean and the breakfast was well-run (if a little boring). It is literally located in the middle of a corn field, which means a cab ride to get to the Venice water taxi. There is a nice garden behind the hotel and a grocery store within easy walking distance. However, there have to be better situated hotels with larger rooms in the Venice area and I cannot recommend Hotel Poppie based upon their location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Missus01
Reviews.Content: Would like to give a big THANK YOU to the staff at Hotel Poppi. I haven't stayed there (haven't been to Italy), but I needed to organise a surprise birthday present for my Mum who did stay at the hotel. Hotel Poppi staff were extremely helpful, especially since I was organising this by email from Australia. Mum said the wine and fruit was amazing - the best cherries she has had! Highly recommend the customer service. Will definitely stay when I make my way to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome and beautiful suites”
Reviews.Author: imoreno
Reviews.Content: The outside llok is not the best, BUT The suite we had was just gorgeous ; it had a living room and was grandiose. It compares to staying in a presidential suite but just smaller; but for the space that most mid size European hotel rooms have; the suite was very specious and up to our expectations. I like the Waldorf Astoria hotel chain hotels, Hilton, this was one we definitely like. I don't know about the other rooms, although I did hear they were small.

Reviews.Title: “Our room was way too small”
Reviews.Author: DrBob317
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night as part of a Cosmos tour. From the outside the hotel looks grand and imposing (belying its rural location) but the room we stayed in was way too small and the bathroom in particular was extremely cramped. Sitting on the toilet was a major challenge, as was getting into the shower. We struck a particularly officious man at reception who was very unhelpful. As if to make up he later directed us to a lovely seating area at the back of the hotel but neglected to warn us of mosquitos. My wife and I were both bitten with consequential swelling on one of her ankles. We were glad to leave. As with most hotels we struck on this tour there were no tea or coffee making facilities in the room, no fridge and no easy internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Worth staying here just for the coffee!”
Reviews.Author: SandraandTodd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2011 as part of a Cosmo tour. The hotel itself was fine, nothing special but clean. The best part of our stay though was the super friendly and helpful lady who ran the bar (never got her name). The coffee and booze was cheap and the nice lady was very polite and helpful as we fumbled our way through our limited (and probably very mispronounced!) Italian. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Avoidable except for transit stay”
Reviews.Author: Sumita62
Reviews.Content: The hotel is poorly located, almost in the middle of nowhere. It is suitable for transits only. We stayed there as a part of a group tour of Europe, on our way to Venice. There is no view to speak of. Our room overlooked an unused terrace. The most frustrating thing about the room was unavailability of a plug point other than on the headboard of the bed...a peculiar place to have a plug point. Could not charge my camera as mobile had to be charged on the sole plug point. No coffee/ tea provision and could not use my own electric kettle to for same reason. No shower caps provided and the hair dryer is fixed at a very awkward place. Room size was okay and bed comfortable. Breakfast was nothing great and there was a rude notice near the water dispenser saying "do not fill water bottles". The same thing could be said more politely and in any case, maybe with a few exceptions, everyone has the sense not to fill water bottles in the breakfast hall!! No interaction with staff....there seemed to a dearth of attendants everywhere. The carpet on the reception floor kept buckling under the strolley bags that were pulled over it. The hotel should have more practical flooring/carpeting. The reception area is also very small.

Reviews.Title: “A so-so hotel in the middle of no where - do not recommend”
Reviews.Author: chatkat_10
Reviews.Content: I did the European Jewels bus tour offered by Cosmos Vacations. The literature did forewarn me that most of the hotels were " in the area" of the major city that the group would be visiting. But I was not expecting to be situated in agricultural land. The Poppi Hotel was WAY out there. Very far away from Venice. The hotel was situated right on a major highway so it was possible to catch a bus that would take you to Venice. About a 30 minute bus trip. I found my room to be shabby, stale and very outdated. Quite a disappointment. The bed and linens however were comfortable and clean. Thank goodness!

Reviews.Title: “Small Room - Tiny Shower....”
Reviews.Author: sena_gooneratne
Reviews.Content: What come down from our previous hotel Simplon on this Cosmos tour. Once again this hotel is located in the middle of nowhere miles from the island of Venice. Furthermore this is located on an extremely busy road. The room was tiny. Two people can just about move. Bloody aweful...!! Careful when you get in the shower that you do not drop the soap. You may have to get out of the shower to pick it up.....!! Thats how tiny it was. The breakfast was just ordinary nothing to write home about. Will not come here even by accident.The dinner provided by the tour was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay.”
Reviews.Author: t2243
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for two nights with a Cosmos tour. Not bad at all. I had a single room up on the top floor, which the elevator did not go up to, so had to take my suitcase myself. Breakfast and dinner were good. Room small, but big enough to suit my requirements. Shower incredibly small. If you are a large person, you will have alot of trouble with the shower. Whole bathroom was minute. This hotel was fine. Nothing wrong except bathroom too small. Not located in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “What an awful experience.”
Reviews.Author: singpon
Reviews.Content: Of course, this had to be one of Cosmos tours choices. The hotel is in the middle of nowhere,not kidding. It's around 15km from there to the ferry to Venice. The bedrooms smell like old. It's quite depressing.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Place - Considerate Staff”
Reviews.Author: tfish_Ohio
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights with a Cosmos' Italy's Best Tour on 11-08-10. Our room at the hotel was very comfortable and clean. The food at the restaurant, both dinner and breakfast, was plentiful and tasty. In addition, my wife left a pair of shoes in the room and they were kind enough to mail them to our home in the U.S. without a charge. It isn't in Venice, but its close. There is a great grocery store next door with all the wine you could ever want. Some of it less than 1 Euro a bottle.

Reviews.Title: “Venice”
Reviews.Author: willy011
Reviews.Content: Hello friends.... We stayed at Hotel Poppi with some friends during our last cosmos tour. This Hotel was very modern and nice,the nicest Hotel we had stayed at out of the others. the rooms were lovely comfy beds,clean room,towels changed daily,the buffet breackfast was good and the hotel buffet restaurant,(we had dinner included the second night) was really nice... We enjoyed it (meatballs,roasted pork,chiken,past,rice,several vegetables.....). The Hotel itself was good enough; staff were friendly and helpfull.We took a bus directly outside of the hotel to the city center,about 20 minutes ride for 2.50 euros. So we reached Venice city center in very easy way. If we 'll go back to Italy and Venice, we would stay there again most certaintly. The Poppi Hotel was my favourite stop on our tour. xoxox Will

Reviews.Title: “How did this hotel get 4 stars?!!!! Don't believe it!”
Reviews.Author: t4metoo
Reviews.Content: An inspector can't have gone past the main entry of this hotel, which gives a nice first impression. The rooms have cell-like proportions and the beds are the most uncomfortable ever! Substandard narrow beds feel like they were reinforced with a steel rod down the center - and sag on either side of it. Cleanliness was questionable at best and bugs were visible. Breakfast was all right but for supper they served up stale cake drizzled with raspberry syrup. Yuk!!! The one good thing I will say about this hotel is that the desk staff provided good, helpful information about how to take the bus into town and that was quite easily done with a bus ticket purchase at the desk. Coming home was rather scary as you are let off on the edge of a dark, busy highway with no shoulder or walking path. The choice of this hotel by Cosmos reflects poorly on them. Check another company to see if they use better hotels in Venice. There are many, much better hotels in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: NKLamb
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I stayed two nights at the Hotel Poppi on a recent Cosmos 6400 tour. This hotel is about 20-30 minues outside of Venice by local bus. I bought a bus ticket from the hotel front desk; the bus stops right across the road (although the road is quite busy so be very careful when crossing). The return bus drops passengers further down the road in front of the "mall." Be careful returning after dark because the parking lot of the mall is a meeting place for hookers and their "customers." I didn't feel in danger, but I got out of there fast (and I would not have wanted to be alone). There is a restaurant in the hotel, which we did not use. There didn't seem to be other meal options within walking distance. Our room had a fridge so we bought cheese, fruit and bread to tide us over.

Reviews.Title: “The smell was awful”
Reviews.Author: Muss28
Reviews.Content: We were with a Cosmos Tour of Italy and checked into our hotel early in the afternoon. The smell in my room was pure sewage. I don't know if the plumbing was having problems but when I we told management they gave us a aerosol spray and was informed they couldn't move us until the next day. We had no choice but to close the bathroom door and open the window. They did move us the next day but that room should never have been rented. I hope Cosmos will move to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"DON'T DROP THE SOAP"”
Reviews.Author: DONNA063
Reviews.Content: This hotel seemed very nice when we arrived the reception area and restaurant both looked very nice . There was a computer for staff to use to email friends and family but you needed to give your passport as ID so if "any criminal" activity was activated on the hotel computer they could trace the person who did it. There was a cost of two euros for about twenty minutes. The rooms in the hotel were small but not tiny, however I CANNOT say the same thing about the shower. The shower was SO SMALL YOU CANNOT EVEN TURN AROUND OR BEND DOWN IF YOU DROP THE SOAP. We were even warned "jokingly by our tour director to be aware that the showers were "quite small". This was the only fault I found but a significant one....LARGE PEOPLE BEWARE YOU WILL NEED TO SHOWER WITH THE DOORS OPEN. Also my son became ill overnight and when I rang reception for the usual in house doctor I was told to either go to the hospital or wait till the morning when they would ring a doctor to come to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Showers very very small”
Reviews.Author: marianna1977
Reviews.Content: Showers are very small, did not have food so can not speak of that, service was ok-

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: raf1980
Reviews.Content: Our stay in the Hotel Poppi was a very enjoyable experience.We were happy with our choice to stay out of the centre of Venice. The staff were very professional efficient and friendly and shown to our room . The service was great-they were nice helping us with any questions we had and gave us good ideas for sight seeing The hotel inside is very modern & updated Our room was very nice, clean & the bathroom was cool. The room was very well appointed, beds are plush. Wi fi internet all over the Hotel. The breakfast is also amazing. A huge spread of pastries, juices, fruit, meats,eggs etc etc etc. Will come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice one !”
Reviews.Author: Paul10880
Reviews.Content: Me and my family staied at the Hotel Poppi last month (july 10) and we were part of a tour. This is not the first time we visit Venice and last time we were in the city-centre. Well, we honestly had no problem at all to reach the City from the Hotel. Since we did not take the dinner-out with the tour, we did decide to go out by our own. Taking a public bus was easy and we did reach the city in just 20 minutes. The people working in the reception gave us the perfect indications on how to move alone. No hard at all to reach the heart of the cityâ€¦we spent great time there ! On the 2nd night we had an included buffet dinner in the hotel and it has been super ! Good variety of food and great service also for the breakfast. We found that this place is very clean with a good service. Our room had 3 comfortable beds in the middle floor facing the street but not noisy at all. We definitely will suggest to any friend who plans to visit the most beautiful city we have been !! Paul and Family.

Reviews.Title: “in the middle of nowhere with poor service”
Reviews.Author: kazganymede
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the day after Christmas and the buffet they served on the Cosmos tour was pathetic. Also our luggage was sent up in the elevator and we had to all fetch it from there, while a few on the tour were stuck with porterage for the whole tour. Poppi is in the middle of nowhere and takes ages to get to the water taxi. I assume Cosmos uses it because it is cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Cosmos Tourists...BEWARE!”
Reviews.Author: italia9970
Reviews.Content: Ugh, this hotel was utterly and completely the worst I've encountered. It is clear that Cosmos Tours has opted for this place as a very cheap alternative to the (presumably) much more expensive hotels that are closer to Venice. You've read about the ultra-tiny showers in the rooms and the so-so comfort of the beds here but the staff ran those items right up a tree. I do believe that the staff at the Hotel Poppi has either breathed in too many bus fumes from all of the motor coaches that come in and out of their parking lot or they just breed them mean out in that cornfield across the road from the hotel. The staff was appallingly rude, particularly to those of us who were American or Australian. We were treated like a herd of cattle and the food they served to us in the "special" buffet room was disgusting. I wouldn't have fed it to a dog. Cosmos would do well to reconsider the accommodations for Venice. It was a complete turn-off to me and I've opted to not take a tour again to avoid such awful behavior in the future.

Reviews.Title: “They called it a Double Room!!!”
Reviews.Author: USAFanUk
Reviews.Content: Have recently returned from tour with Archers - room we were given was supposed to be a double but on looking at the floor plan we could seee it was originally a single!! Ridiculously small room with no space to store suitcases. Bathroom was also small with shower cubicle so tiny - beware if you drop the soap (& we are not particularly large! - honest). Would most definitely not recommend. Also (as is typical with coach tours) was not central.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel near Venice”
Reviews.Author: AlmostRetiredNiagara
Reviews.Content: The motel is relatively new and almost out in the country which is nice for a quiet rest but not if you want to be close to all of the action in Venice. We were on a bus tour and basically only slept for a few hours at the Hotel and thus it was fine. The rooms were very clean and the staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Have had three stays at the Hotel Poppi”
Reviews.Author: grammy3158
Reviews.Content: All of my three stays here, 2007, 2008 and 2009 were aok. Room was comfortable. Food was very good. The only complaint I had the lady in charge of the restaurant was very rude. We were with Cosmos. Was easy to get to Venice. Took our bus and then motorboat. The rest of the employees were very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Don't move in the shower!!”
Reviews.Author: subyrv
Reviews.Content: Like most other people, we stayed at the Hotel Poppi as part of a Cosmos tour. There were 4 tour buses there when we stayed there so I think that's what keeps the hotel going as it is in the middle of a cornfield and nothing around it. The room was very small and the bathroom, especially the shower very very small. My husband isn't a big person, but every time he moved in the shower he was hitting the taps and the temperature was changed. The breakfast was nice, staff were friendly enough. Rooms were clean enough. Restaurant was easily able to cater for all of the tour buses in at the one time. For people travelling through Europe to see the countries, this hotel is a poor choice by Cosmos as it took 40 minutes on the bus just to get to the mainland. There was some shops about 500 m up the road, but to get to them you had to walk along a dark road - no thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: ReshmaM
Reviews.Content: The rooms are really beautiful, great romantic setting. The hotel itself is situated away from the hustle and bustle of the town but in close proximity to amenities. Good service, great food.

Reviews.Title: “no elevator on the THIRD floor”
Reviews.Author: sunny_capri
Reviews.Content: We had to walk up the stairs as there was no elevator to get up there. It was really hot in the hotel too. All the electrical outlets for my own blowdryer did not work and so the fuse was blown and had to be reset so had to use the hotel blowdryer but those get overheated very quickly and so its hard and hot on your hands and fingers having to push the on button down without an automatic on switch. Our shower stall was very small and there wasn't even a provided bathmat. The bedspread was a heavy winter duvet so we had to call them to get a much lighter bedspread since it was summer and the room was sweltering hot. The only positive thing about this hotel was the decent dinner buffet which consisted of meatballs in tomato sauce, pork, corn , rice, pasta.

Reviews.Title: “filthy bathroom and extremely rude employees”
Reviews.Author: jjw62au
Reviews.Content: The shower had pubic hair in the base when we arrived and the drain was totally blocked. We asked for another room and were told there was none left so we asked to have it repaired, they said ok. Nobody bothered to turn up but we received half a dozen towels instead to soak up the mess. Not acceptable to have a room without a shower during a heatwave. Also there were many prostitutes soliciting out the front of the hotel most of the night, not an ideal spot for a tourist hotel. The hotel is situated too far away from any attractions. Asked hotel staff for information on public transport into Venice, they were extremely rude and unfriendly.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: hippodreams
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the start of an escorted Cosmos tour. We found the hotel to be quite clean and pleasant, and the rooms very comfortable if a little on the small side. We were in Venice during some hot weather and found the hotel nice and cool, after being out in the heat. The hotel is not actually in Venice itself but a fair distance away on the mainland. The bus did stop right at the hotel which was great for us as we were hauling all our luggage with us. I probably wouldn't stay here again, only due to the location, but the hotel itself was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room”
Reviews.Author: Aussietriptraveller
Reviews.Content: Our stay was part of a Cosmos Tour. This hotel presents well from outside, but it is about the smallest room we have ever stayed in anywhere. Quite high ceilings, which did help a bit with the lack of length and breadth in the room. Rather hard to get into the shower (and we are not large). Breakfast was quite poor for a tour breakfast, and unfortunately we were here for two nights. Staff were quite friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Isolated as out-of-town but otherwise great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Readybluedragon
Reviews.Content: Quite modern with large bedrooms with comfy beds. Very quet. Bathrooms small with tiny showers. Towels very thin so was disappointed here. It is way out of town on a busy road but traffic wasn't a problem due to double glazed windows. We all walked down to the supermarket (about 20 minute walk) to buy food for dinner as no restaurants, besides hotel and pizza, closeby. Good price for its location but if you are looking for action - this isn't the place! About half an hour by car to Venice itself. Internet too slow here too!

Reviews.Title: “Superb restaurant, good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ragazzoDenmark
Reviews.Content: Looking at previous reviews makes me laugh. The hotel is a very good at the price you pay. Obviously 99% of the people staying at the hotel is travelling on a tour, pretending to get world class treatment for no money. If they have been told they will get a hotel for no money in the middle of Venice, i understand their disappointment, on the other hand, how stupid can you be. I have seen these groups arrive at the hotel, talk about rude and screaming people, not the staff, but the guests. Seems the people criticizing the food in the restaurant, does not have a clue of what they are talking about and should stay away from Italy. This restaurant is considered one of the very best seafood restaurants in the area, visited regularely by a lot of local fish dealers. I, being in the fishbussines for the last 40 years, have stayed and eathen at Poppi`s numerous times during the years, always with local colleagues and always eaten superb fresh local seafood. This restaurant can be recommended a 100%, for people who are looking for superb local seafood at reasonble prices. The only reason people could stay away from this place in the future would be the hordes of ignorant and impatient, rude, demanding low cost tourist. Throw them out and concentrate on quality minded people

Reviews.Title: “What A Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lilybella09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Poppi during our recent Splendors of Italy - Cosmos Tour. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The rooms were spotless! The bar was just beautiful - and very nice gal tending bar. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Poppi Hotel-Not a great area at night”
Reviews.Author: Italy_Feedback
Reviews.Content: We to stayed here for 2 nights on the Cosmos Spendors of Italy Tout. The hotel itself is nice, clean and sooundproof, but it is in the middle of no where. Do take the excursion for Venice at night. Not only is it beautiful, but you do not have to worry about getting into Venice on your own. A few of our tour collegues ventured out by the bus, but never made it to San Marco island ( St. Mark's square etc..) and got lost. The main issue was getting off the bus at the shopping center when returning to the Poppi. At night, truckers park their rigs and the local prostitues use the shopping center as there pick up spot. After 10 pm the bus runs only every hour. A few people did not feel comfortable and were nervous.

Reviews.Title: “Cosmos tour hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mrsheathershaw
Reviews.Content: First hotel as part of a Cosmos tour of Italy so only needed as a "start" location. Clean room,clean linen and very comfortable beds. Tiny shower but clean bathroom. We got the "tour" breakfast which was different to the other guests and was poor. Excellent soundproofing at windows as is on a busy main road.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay at.”
Reviews.Author: jayend
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice, clean, and highly reccommended. there is a bus stop across from the hotel that takes you directly to Venice. the ride is about 30 minutes and cost 2 Euro. there is also a shopping center about 5 minutes walk away from the hotel. the breakfast and dinner was excellent. I stayed here as part of a Cosmos Italy tour. The staff all speaks english and very friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Fine”
Reviews.Author: bj4850
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights as part of tour. Hotel fine, rooms adequate and clean, very pleasant bathroom. Breakfast OK. Staff very helpful and polite. A 40-80min trip to Vence.

Reviews.Title: “far from everywhere, close to no where”
Reviews.Author: jeffreyah
Reviews.Content: this is what I call a tour bus hotel. who would stay here other wise. It is a nice hotel, nice staff, nice grounds to sit out back but you are miles and miles from Venice and darn near impossible to get there on your own. Unless on a tour and you have no choice, DO NOT STAY HERE if you are planning to visit Venice. for those on a tour you will not be disappointed with this place. Cosmos chooses this place, I believe, because where else are you going to eat dinner unless you buy one of their extra, expensive tours. They know what they are doing.

Reviews.Title: “Bad for indepedents, for group tours - take optionals!”
Reviews.Author: ArmchairGypsy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with the Cosmos Splendors of Italy tour in May. Location is as bad as everyone says it is. SO - if you are an independent traveller, pls stay in Venice at a B&B or a hotel there - even if you end up paying a little more there it will be worth the extra time you get in Venice and the relaxation of knowing you don't have to hurry back by boat, train and bus! The hotel is in the middle of nowhere and a good 30-40 min drive to the Tronchetto port where you catch the 20min water bus to Venice St Marco. Cosmos/group tour folks - if you are on a tight budget, save some money by avoiding other optionals/buying water at supermarkets instead of at the tourists sights but you MUST do the Venice optional night tour. If you don't , you are stuck in a highway motel - the Mira Poppi - with nothing to do but watch TV. Optional takes you into the city by night when it is quieter, no rush of tourists and is really quite romantic. They take you there by bus and then boat and same for coming back. We left at 6pm and reached venice by 7pm, then left at 11pm from Venice and came back by midnight. If you try and do it on your own it can be a big pain and even a tad scary cos of the location (very industrial) and unlike Rome no one speaks a word of English on the mainland(Tronchetto and Mira) - even cops won't be able to help you with directions if you can't speak Italian. They want to help but won't be able to, also Tronchetto is quite isolated (we spotted no one other than our group and another plus 1 sole person manning the vaporetto/waterbus stop ticket counter) so if you plan to do the evening thing on your own be sure your maps, money and knowledge of italian are in place! The hotel itself - breakfast was basic. Included dinner on 2nd night was simple but food was tasty - meatballs, pasta, rice, eggs, grilled veggies, salad. dessert was a dry slice of fruit cake - avoidable. Room was small but clean, but the carpet felt like it hadn't been cleaned in a while..was a tad sticky and damp...thankfully we didnt spend much time in the room! Was quiet though, which was gd. Air conditioning worked fine.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TIffany946
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of the Cosmos Splendors of Italy Tour. This hotel was the nicest hotel we had stayed at out of the others. Hotel Poppi is a very modern and nice hotel. The hotel was clean, we had a full bed, and was quiet. It was probably the quietest hotel we had all week. Although, the hotel is far from Venice Island, the bus was pretty easy and safe. There was also a grocery store very close by that we were able to stock up on water very inexpensively .20 a bottle!! Overall the hotel was nice, and I'm glad we had the opportunity to stay here. Since we were in Italy during this time of the year, we were able to see the Poppi's they were EVERYWHERE!! The gorgeous red flower was through fields an dall throughout the countryside. During the summer the Poppi's die off and the sunflowers appear.

Reviews.Title: “Staff went above and beyond to ensure a WONDERFUL experience!”
Reviews.Author: ItalianArmyBrat
Reviews.Content: My dad was in the US Army and I was born in Chioggia, Italy (just outside of Venice). We left Italy when I was 15 months and I do not have a single memory of my life overseas. Twenty-six years later I returned to see my birthplace and share the experience with my husband. Before we left the US, I read reviews on all the hotels that Cosmos booked for our trip. All were great except Hotel Poppi. I was very scared. I almost considered booking anther hotel while we were in Venice just to avoid Poppi. I am so glad that I didn't. The staff at Hotel Poppi was extrodinary. When we arrived (before we even got to our room) we asked for assistance finding a family in Chioggia that helped my parents adjust to Italy. The gentleman at the front desk pulled out a phone book and attempted to help me find my long lost family. I speak no Italian so finding an Italian family would be difficult for me to say the least. This gentleman at Hotel Poppi called several families to see if they were the one's I knew. We had no luck. I didn't figure that I would be able to find my family but I still wanted to find our apartment. Next up, getting to Chioggia. I was told there was a bus that traveled from Venice to Chioggia. Hotel Poppi sells tickets into Venice but not to Chioggia. The gentleman at the front desk said that he would find out where we could buy tickets and let us know. My husband and I went upstairs and less than 15 minutes later our room phone rang. We could get tickets just around the corner and the bus would be in front of the hotel in less than 10 minutes. We had to rush if we would make it in time. When we got downstairs, the man at the desk had his personal vehicle pulled up front to drive us to get tickets. He helped us buy them and then dropped us off at the bus stop. We missed the bus by 30 seconds. It was actually for the best. Just to finish off the story. We made it to Chioggia and found my old apartment. Oddly enough, my italian family still lived in the same apartment building. Remember I don't speak Italian. Missing the first bus paid off because a woman was entering the apartment building that spoke english and helped me find my long lost family. Other than my wedding day, this was the best moment in my life. I finally had the chance to meet my italian Grandmother, Aunts, Uncles, and Cousins. Without Hotel Poppi I am not sure that my dream would have come true. Thank you so much!!! Don't believe all the bad posts on this website. I will return to Italy and I will return to Hotel Poppi. P.S. The hotel was the best hotel we stayed at regardless of my personal experience. The rooms were lovely (newly remodeled), the breakfast was good, the dinner was good, and the internet worked very well. All in all, I give Hotel Poppi an A+!

Reviews.Title: “Name fits the Service”
Reviews.Author: VIOLETTA22
Reviews.Content: This hotel looked nice on the outside but with an unexpected interior. The only good thing was the buffet breakfast and dinner. Staff were very inpatient and sarcastic, lifts only took one person at a time and internet access a rip off,10 euro for 30 min of which 20 minutes was spent trying to overcome problems logging on and restarting. The location on a very busy main road in the middle of no where, city of Venice on the opposite side of the planet. Rooms very humid and no double beds.Shopping mall within walking distance, no night life only chirping crickets from the vast open paddock opposite the hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Nothing wrong, good choice...”
Reviews.Author: dreamtravel_eagle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Poppi with some friends last November and we loved that Hotel. Yes,it's a bit far from the Island, but we reached the Centre in a really easy way. We asked at the desk info how to get there and they have been nice to explain . Map, bus schedule and more info are available at desk. I remember there's a bus every 30 minutes bringing you to the square, then you can walk around or take a water bus. So i can't understand people saying location can be a trouble: for me not at all. We did eat 2nd night there and there was a nice buffet as well as buffet breakfast has been served in the morning. We found the room was clean and nice staff. We definetely loved that Hotel and we think has been one of the best we have been during the Tour.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Staff are theives!! avoid at all cost! stay away! to far from Veince”
Reviews.Author: flowerbrdg
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Poppi's staff are theives!! They stole expensive Murano Glass from my hotel room when we went out to explore Venice. I even put my "do not disturb" sign out and they still went into my room to steal my Murano glass. If your tour group goes here find another hotel to stay in, or just don't go on this tour. First of all the hotel is in the middle of nowhere and far, i mean far from Vience and when the cleaning lady cleans the rooms she goes to every room on the floor and opens every door wide open while she cleans the other rooms. I actually forgot something one day so i had to go back to the hotel to get it and when i arrived there every room was open I could have walked in and out of multiple rooms and nobody would have known. Please, Please, please contact me with questions about this hotel I am so infuriated with this hotel that they actually stole my things and refuse to acknowledge it that I want everyone to know.

Reviews.Title: “"Goodnight and thank you!"”
Reviews.Author: PeanutDotJU
Reviews.Content: We spent our first night of an Archer's tour at the Hotel Poppi. As other reviewers have commented, the hotel was in an isolated location situated on a motorway. As we arrived on a Sunday afternoon, not even the supermarket on the adjacent complex was open. This meant that the only place we could obtain food and drink from was the hotel, giving it a monopoly and allowing them to charge extortionate prices. Due to the circumstances we had to rely on the hotel bar for lunch and this consisted of dry, unappetising sandwiches at 5 Euros each (when even in the centre of Venice we paid no more than 3!). To make matters worse, in the evening the bar was closed at 9.45 with "Thank you and goodnight." As there was nothing else to do and it was afterall the first night of our holidays, we sat outside and chatted only to be eaten alive by mosquitos!! I'm sure we made a more tasty snack than the sandwiches!! Apart from the above, it is a modern hotel and the food served at the evening meal was acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “nothing wrong with the poppi just the whingers”
Reviews.Author: getaboutalotwales
Reviews.Content: stayed at the "poppi" whilst on cosmos italian masterpiece tour.The poppi is a modern hotel along side a motorway to venice.It is true to say there is some traffic noise in the front of the hotel.I was concerned about stayed here having being put off by some of the petty whinging reviews.However,i found reception helpful friendly and efficient.Forty two of us arrived at the same time and were soon in our rooms our cases were delivered shortly after.I dined at the hotel and found the staff v/friendly and the food above average.Bar was excellent too.It was a 20minute local bus ride to venice (cheap too)and as venice is an island everyone has to get a boat to venice centre this is not anything to do with the poppi.The bus stop was next to the hotel.Would stay at the poppi anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Almost near Venice”
Reviews.Author: jaxxman
Reviews.Content: A comfortable stay on tour, even if the room and bathroom were a little small. Comfy beds, clean room, towels changed daily. Food typically bland but ok. Fine for touring but isolated from anywhere even ruling out an evening stroll.

Reviews.Title: “Please do not stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: TTIOT
Reviews.Content: We arrived here as part of our Cosmos tour for a two night horror stay. The hotel is in the middle of nowhere. It could have been in Planet Pluto. While the location is bad enough, what was worse is the reception staff. You politely ask them where are the good restaurants located in San Marco and they tell you a coffee costs more than a day's wages from where you come from! Where does he think I come from? Can you believe this? I couldn't myself. A fellow Cosmos traveller heard the same words and he couldn't believe what he heard too. The dinner and breakfast in the hotel which was served to all the tour groups was like school canteen food or worse. So, if you are looking for 1. a hotel in no man's land 2. rude and condescending staff 3. lousy food, yep, you've found the right place to enjoy your Venetian Night. Cosmos, if I were you, get this hotel off your list or else you're just ruining your own franchise

Reviews.Title: “Miles from anywhere”
Reviews.Author: trev2906
Reviews.Content: Like many others, we stayed here for one night as part of an Archer's tourgroup. Room was small and drab, though relatively clean. Staff were quite friendly so no problems there, but the hotel was way out from the centre of town which made an independent visit to Venice a virtual no-go. Unless you were forced to stay here in a holiday group booking, you just wouldn't bother!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Poppi was 'just okay'”
Reviews.Author: xLoquitax
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with an Archers Direct tour a few weeks ago. Quite small and dark inside, but the hotel was nice, despite having no amenities to come with it. The dinner buffet was nice, and the breakfast buffet was okay and common for your typical continental breakfast. Only problem we had was the location; out in the middle of nowhere, we only got to go into Venice for one out of the two days with the coach and left early the next morning. Overall not a bad hotel, i would just prefer something in the city itself for next time.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Poppi
HotelInfo.Address: Romea, 80 | Gambarare di Mira, 30030 Venice, Italy
